content.question: In the sixteenth and seventeenth centuries, which of the following most directly challenged the economic power of family-based banking houses, such as the one owned by the Medicis?

choices.label: The widespread adoption of double-entry bookkeeping
The increased tendency of governments to borrow money in order to finance their growing military expenditures
The enactment of free trade policies by most European states
The spread of new mechanisms for raising capital, such as the joint-stock company

content.answer: The spread of new mechanisms for raising capital, such as the joint-stock company

skill.text: Skill 5.A: Identify patterns among or connections between historical developments and processes.
